item.title: V. Narayanan, who is set to take over as ISRO Chairman, terms his new assignment ‘a great responsibility’ - The Hindu
item.description:
V. Narayanan Set to Lead ISRO with Great Responsibility

Published on: January 08, 2025 Source: The Hindu

V. Narayanan, a rocket propulsion expert, will take over as the Chairman of ISRO on January 14, 2025. He describes this new role as a significant responsibility and opportunity to lead ISRO during a transformative time in India's space sector.

  • Succeeds S. Somanath as ISRO Chairman.
  • ISRO has several major projects lined up including Gaganyaan, Chandrayaan-4, and an Indian space station.
  • Dr. Narayanan emphasizes the importance of increasing India's presence in space and the role of private sector reforms in achieving this goal.
  • He has a substantial background in rocket propulsion, having been with ISRO since 1984.
“Towards January-end we have the GSLV Mk-II/IRNSS-1 K mission... we have our hands full.”

In conclusion, Dr. Narayanan's extensive experience and vision for reform will be crucial as ISRO embarks on its ambitious future projects.

item.title: Ramesh Bidhuri to be replaced? Unease in BJP ahead of Delhi election: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Unease in BJP Over Ramesh Bidhuri's Controversial Remarks Ahead of Delhi Elections

January 08, 2025 - Hindustan Times

BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri’s recent controversial remarks about Delhi chief minister Atishi and Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra have sparked a backlash, leading to discussions within the party about replacing him with a woman candidate for the upcoming assembly election.

  • There have been at least two organisational meetings regarding Bidhuri's candidacy.
  • His remarks led to a reprimand from BJP leader JP Nadda.
  • Potential women replacements for Bidhuri are being discussed.
  • Bidhuri commented on Atishi's family name change, which drew criticism.
“Not just against Atishi, Rameshji’s statement on Priyanka Gandhi Vadra led to his being reprimanded by Naddaji within minutes,” a BJP source stated.

The situation highlights internal tensions in the BJP as it prepares for the February 5 assembly election.

item.title: 1 body recovered as forces resume operation to rescue trapped coal miners in Assam - The Times of India
item.description:
1 Body Recovered as Forces Resume Operation to Rescue Trapped Coal Miners in Assam

Date: October 2023 Source: The Economic Times

Rescue operations have resumed in Assam after the recovery of one body of a coal miner. Efforts continue to locate the remaining trapped miners.

  • One body has been recovered while others remain missing.
  • Rescue teams are engaged in ongoing operations to find the trapped individuals.
  • The incident has highlighted safety concerns in coal mining operations.
"We are working diligently to ensure everyone's safety and get the missing miners out as soon as possible," a rescue official stated.

The incident raises critical questions about mine safety and the need for improved regulations.

item.title: India on alert regarding China's proposed dam on Brahmaputra: Rajnath Singh - The Hindu
item.description:
India on Alert Regarding China's Proposed Mega Dam on Brahmaputra

Date: January 08, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh announced that the Indian government is monitoring China's plan to build a mega dam on the Brahmaputra river, indicating potential concerns for downstream water flow and regional security.

  • India is closely watching developments regarding China's planned mega dam on the Brahmaputra river.
  • The dam poses potential risks to water flow impacting downstream states, prompting the Indian government's alert stance.
  • Rajnath Singh emphasized, "The Indian government is on alert" regarding the construction.
  • Singh highlighted India's growing global presence and economic strength, aiming to rank among the top three economies in the near future.
  • He urged educators to play a pivotal role in shaping the future of students.
"Earlier, people did not take it seriously when India spoke at international forums, but now when India speaks, the world listens." - Rajnath Singh

The Indian government remains vigilant on the matter, reinforcing the importance of international dialogue concerning regional water resources.

item.title: The Hindu Morning Digest, January 8, 2024 - The Hindu
item.description:
The Hindu Morning Digest: Key Updates from January 8, 2024

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: The Hindu

This article provides a summary of significant events reported on January 8, 2024, including political actions, government decisions, and upcoming legal reviews.

  • General Strike Warning: 10 trade unions threaten to call a general strike if the Centre notifies new labour codes.
  • Pranab Mukherjee Memorial: The Centre has earmarked a site at Rajghat for erecting a memorial for former President Pranab Mukherjee.
  • UGC Draft Regulation: Students' body and teachers question new UGC draft regulation on faculty appointments, criticizing it for centralizing power.
  • Sri Lanka-China Relations: Sri Lankan President Dissanayake is set to visit China from January 14.
  • Same-Sex Marriage Review: The Supreme Court will hear petitions on January 9 regarding the review of its previous ruling on same-sex marriage.
  • New ISRO Chief: Dr. V. Narayanan has been appointed as the new Space Secretary and ISRO Chairman.
  • AI Governance: An inter-ministerial committee is recommended to strengthen governance in AI by the Centre's IndiaAI Mission.
  • Bangladesh Political Turmoil: Bangladesh revokes the passport of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and others linked to protests.
  • IAF Chief Comments: IAF chief states that R&D loses relevance if it doesn't meet project timelines.
  • Allahabad High Court Ruling: Court dismisses plea against the impeachment motion for Justice Shekhar Yadav.
  • Supreme Court Recommendation: Collegium recommends Patna HC Chief Justice for appointment to the Supreme Court.
"Research and Development loses relevance if it does not meet timelines," - Air Chief Marshal A.P. Singh.

In conclusion, the updates from January 8 demonstrate ongoing significant political discussions and actions affecting various sectors in India.

item.title: Delhi cold wave to intensify with temperatures set to plummet to 5 degrees this week - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Cold Wave to Intensify with Temperatures Set to Plummet to 5 Degrees This Week

Date: Jan 08, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian Meteorological Department forecasts a significant temperature drop in Delhi, with a minimum expected temperature of 5 degrees Celsius by Friday amidst adverse weather conditions.

  • Temperatures in Delhi are projected to decrease starting Wednesday.
  • The Safdarjung observatory recorded a maximum temperature of 16.2 degrees Celsius, above normal.
  • Air Quality Index (AQI) remains in the "very poor" category, measuring 335 on Monday.
  • Restrictions under Stage 1 and 2 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) still apply in Delhi-NCR.
  • Dense fog reduced visibility significantly, leading to the delay of 25 trains.
The IMD reported that minimum visibility was recorded at 500 meters at Safdarjung, and at Palam, visibility was as low as 150 meters.

This severe cold wave and deteriorating air quality highlight ongoing challenges for residents in Delhi due to adverse weather conditions.

item.title: Meet V Narayanan, who is set to succeed S Somanath as ISRO chief - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Meet V Narayanan, who is set to succeed S Somanath as ISRO chief

Date: Jan 08, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

V Narayanan has been appointed as the new chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), succeeding S Somanath, effective from January 14, 2025.

  • V Narayanan is a distinguished scientist with nearly four decades of experience in rocket and spacecraft propulsion.
  • He began his career at ISRO in 1984 and has since held various roles, including director of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).
  • Narayanan has made significant contributions in solid propulsion for sounding rockets and various launch vehicles.
  • He is currently the director of LPSC, with responsibilities for propelling India's space missions.
  • ISRO recently gained attention for launching SpaDex, an initiative that places India among countries with advanced space docking technology.
"The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet has approved the appointment of Shri V. Narayanan...for a period of two years with effect from 14.01.2025, or until further orders, whichever is earlier.”

Narayanan's extensive experience is expected to guide ISRO through its upcoming ambitious projects, including Chandrayaan 4 and Gaganyaan.

item.title: Claws out: Man catches leopard by its tail, saves villagers from jaws of death - The Times of India
item.description:
Claws out: Man catches leopard by its tail, saves villagers from jaws of death

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Not specified

A heroic act by a man saved a village from a potentially deadly leopard encounter.

  • A man caught a leopard by its tail.
  • His actions prevented harm to the villagers.
  • This incident highlights the ongoing human-wildlife conflict in the region.
“It was a dangerous situation, but I knew I had to act.” - Local hero

This event underscores the need for better wildlife management and community awareness to prevent such encounters in the future.

item.title: ‘You Are Virtually A Stranger’: Supreme Court To Atul Subhash’s Mother Who Sought Kid’s Custody - News18
item.description:
Supreme Court Denies Custody to Atul Subhash's Mother, Calls Her 'Virtually a Stranger'

Date: January 07, 2025

Source: News18

The Supreme Court has refused the plea of Atul Subhash's mother seeking custody of her grandson, stating she is virtually a stranger to the child. The court emphasized the necessity of following proper legal procedures for such matters.

  • The Supreme Court denied custody of Atul Subhash’s son to his mother.
  • Justice Sharma highlighted that there is a separate procedure for custody issues.
  • The court advised her to visit the child rather than label her daughter-in-law as guilty without proof.
  • Atul Subhash had committed suicide on December 9, alleging harassment from his estranged wife and her family.
  • The habeas corpus petition regarding this case is pending until January 20.
“You’re virtually a stranger to the child. If you wish, please visit the child.” - Supreme Court

This case illustrates the complex interplay between family law and personal circumstances influenced by tragic events.

item.title: We’ve lost everything: Father after death of only son at IIM Bangalore - The Indian Express
item.description:
We’ve lost everything: Father after death of only son at IIM Bangalore

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

On January 5, Kailash Patel celebrated his son Nilay's 28th birthday, unaware that a tragic incident would leave him bereft hours later. Nilay, a second-year Post Graduate student at IIM Bangalore, was found dead beneath his hostel balcony shortly after his birthday celebration.

  • Nilay Patel was celebrated for his academic achievements, including a top position in a competition among IIM students.
  • He was preparing for campus placements and had secured an internship before his untimely death.
  • The family questions the circumstances of his death, emphasizing that there was no apparent stress in his life.
  • The police have registered a case of accidental death, with an investigation underway.
“We have lost everything in the world that we saved for. We dreamt of a good education for him and then his marriage and later, to play with our grandchildren. All our dreams have vanished.”

The father has urged college authorities to enhance safety measures at the hostel to prevent such tragic events in the future.

item.title: Army, Navy, NDRF deployed to rescue 11 trapped in flooded Assam 'rat hole' mine - The Times of India
item.description:
Army, Navy, NDRF Deployed to Rescue 11 Trapped in Assam 'Rat Hole' Mine

Date: October 13, 2023
Source: Times of India

In a desperate attempt to save 11 workers trapped inside a flooded 'rat hole' mine in Assam, the Army, Navy, and National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) have been deployed. These rescue operations come amidst severe flash floods that have affected the region for days.

  • The workers were conducting illegal coal mining when the mine became flooded.
  • Rescue teams are utilizing high-powered pumps to drain water from the mine.
  • Local authorities have ramped up efforts to reach the trapped individuals quickly.
“We are working tirelessly to ensure the safety of those trapped in the mine,” said a rescue spokesperson.

The situation remains critical, as families of the trapped workers anxiously await updates on their loved ones.

item.title: V. Narayanan appointed new Space Secretary and ISRO chief - The Hindu
item.description:
Dr. V. Narayanan appointed as new Space Secretary and ISRO Chairman

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Dr. V. Narayanan has been appointed the new Space Secretary and will also become the Chairman of ISRO, succeeding S. Somanath.

  • Dr. Narayanan will take over from January 14, 2025, for a period of two years.
  • He has been with ISRO since 1984, serving in various capacities.
  • He is an expert in rocket and spacecraft propulsion.
  • Previously directed the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).
  • Contributed significantly to ISRO's Geosynchronous launch vehicles.
“The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet has approved appointment of V. Narayanan, Director, Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre, Valiamala as Secretary, Department of Space, and Chairman, Space Commission for a period of two years with effect from 14.01.2025, or until further orders, whichever is earlier.”

Dr. Narayanan takes over from Mr. Somanath, who oversaw major ISRO missions including Chandrayaan-3.

item.title: Delhi Assembly Elections 2025| We are opening 'Sheesh Mahal'; challenge BJP to open PM's 'Rajmahal', says AAP's Sanjay Singh - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Delhi Assembly Elections 2025: AAP's Sanjay Singh Challenges BJP on 'Sheesh Mahal' Claims

Date: 07 January 2025, Source: Deccan Herald

AAP MP Sanjay Singh invited the media to tour Arvind Kejriwal's former official residence, challenging BJP's claims of it being a 'Sheesh Mahal'.

  • Singh challenged BJP leaders to visit the CM's residence and prove their claims about its lavishness.
  • He alleged that PM Modi resides in a 'Rajmahal' worth Rs 2,700 crores and urged similar media scrutiny.
  • Singh accused BJP of running a propaganda campaign related to the allegations of luxury in Kejriwal's residence.
  • The BJP is making these claims a focal point of its election campaign.
  • Singh demanded evidence of extravagant features such as a swimming pool and a minibar that BJP claims exist in the residence.
  • Delhi BJP president claimed valuable items were missing after Kejriwal vacated the bungalow.
"Show us where is the swimming pool, the minibar and the golden toilet. The people of Delhi and the country deserve to know the truth." - Sanjay Singh

This ongoing dispute highlights the tension between AAP and BJP in the lead-up to the elections, with both parties aiming to influence public perception.

item.title: Jammu-Kashmir train aims to tackle sub-zero temp - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jammu-Kashmir Train Aims to Tackle Sub-Zero Temperatures

Date: Jan 08, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The first-ever train linking Jammu with Kashmir, the tailor-made Vande Bharat Express, is set to tackle sub-zero temperatures and is ready for inauguration by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

  • Built to operate in extreme cold with advanced heating systems.
  • Journey time from Jammu to Srinagar reduced from 8-9 hours to 3 hours and 10 minutes.
  • Equipped with features to prevent freezing of water tanks and ensure safety.
  • Part of the Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Rail Link project, enhancing regional rail connectivity.
  • Utilizes the Chenab Rail Bridge, the world's highest rail bridge.
“This train will prevent freezing of water tanks and bio-toilet tanks, with overheat protection sensors for safety and reliability.” - Northern Railways Official

This innovative train service is expected to significantly improve travel times and experiences for passengers in the region.

item.title: V Narayanan Appointed New ISRO Chief, Will Take Over From S Somanath - NDTV
item.description:
V Narayanan Appointed New ISRO Chief, Will Take Over From S Somanath

Date: New Delhi

The Centre has appointed V Narayanan as the new chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation and Secretary, Department of Space. Mr Narayanan will take over from S Somanath, the current head of the organisation, on January 14.

  • V Narayanan is currently the head of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).
  • He played a key role in the development of India's cryogenic engine technology.
  • Mr Narayanan aims to take ISRO to greater heights with a clear roadmap for the future.
  • He has been with ISRO since 1984 and has held various significant positions.
  • S Somanath, the outgoing chief, led ISRO during significant missions including the successful Moon landing.
“We have a clear roadmap for India and I hope to take ISRO to greater heights as we have great talent,” - V Narayanan

In conclusion, V Narayanan's appointment marks a new chapter in ISRO's leadership, promising continued advancements in India's space exploration efforts.

item.title: India extends ex-B’desh PM Sheikh Hasina’s visa amid extradition call by Dhaka - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India Extends Visa for Ex-Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina Amid Extradition Calls

Date: January 08, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

India has extended the visa of deposed Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, who fled to India amid protests. This decision comes despite growing calls from Dhaka for her extradition.

  • Sheikh Hasina has been in India since August 2024, following her departure amid nationwide protests in Bangladesh.
  • The interim government in Dhaka formally requested her extradition on December 23, 2024.
  • India’s Home Ministry was involved in extending Hasina's visa through the Foreigners Regional Registration Office.
  • Bangladesh has cancelled passports of 97 individuals, including Hasina, related to enforced disappearances and killings during protests.
  • An arrest warrant for Hasina has been issued by Bangladesh's International Criminal Tribunal.
“The passports department cancelled passports of 75 people, including Sheikh Hasina, due to their involvement in the July killings,” - Abul Kalam Azad Majumder

The situation surrounding Sheikh Hasina highlights the complexities of international relations and the legal ramifications of political asylum. The extension of her visa indicates India's current stance on the matter amidst diplomatic pressures.

item.title: Isro to get new chief: Dr V Narayanan to take over from S Somnath on Jan 14 - India Today
item.description:
Dr V Narayanan Appointed as New Isro Chief Starting January 14

Publication Date: Jan 7, 2025

Source: India Today

Dr V Narayanan has been named the next chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro). He will take over from S Somnath on January 14.

  • Dr V Narayanan is currently the Director of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).
  • He has nearly four decades of experience in various key positions at Isro.
  • Expert in rocket and spacecraft propulsion, he led the successful C25 Cryogenic Project of the GSLV Mk III.
  • Under his guidance, the LPSC has delivered 183 Liquid Propulsion Systems for Isro missions.
  • His contributions include work on the propulsion systems for Chandrayaan-2 and Chandrayaan-3.
“The leadership of Dr Narayanan marks a significant new chapter in Isro's future endeavors.”

Dr V Narayanan's extensive experience and contributions to Isro make him an ideal choice for leading the organization into its next phase of space exploration.

item.title: YS Abhishek Reddy Passes Away.. - Greatandhra
item.description:
YS Abhishek Reddy Passes Away

Date & Source: N/A

Y S Abhishek Reddy, State Secretary of the YSRCP Medical Department and a close relative of former Chief Minister Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy, has passed away due to health complications.

  • He was a key figure in the YSRCP and served as Lingala Mandal In-charge for the 2024 general election campaign.
  • His contributions to the party earned him great respect among members and his community.
  • Abhishek Reddy's demise has left the YSRCP leadership and supporters in shock and sorrow.
  • He was being treated at AIG Hospital in Hyderabad.
“His passing marks a profound loss for the YSRCP and his family. May his soul rest in peace.”

Abhishek Reddy will be remembered for his dedication and service to the community.

item.title: Torres ponzi scheme fraud: Uzbek national, Russian OCI among 3 arrested, LOCs against mastermind Ukranians - The Indian Express
item.description:
Torres Ponzi Scheme Fraud: Three Arrested

Publication Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The Mumbai police have arrested three individuals linked to the alleged Torres Ponzi scheme that defrauded about 125,000 investors, totaling approximately Rs 1,000 crore. The founders, believed to be Ukrainian nationals, are on the run as authorities ramp up the investigation.

  • Three senior officials of Platinum Hern Pvt Ltd, operating under the Torres jewelry brand, were detained by the Mumbai police.
  • The company allegedly aimed at attracting investors with schemes promising high returns, leading to the financial loss of over Rs 13.48 crore from initial claims.
  • Look Out Circulars have been issued for the two alleged masterminds suspected to be abroad.
  • Investigators indicated that the company operated without approval from the Reserve Bank of India or other regulatory authorities.
  • Police seized cash and froze bank accounts linked to the company during the investigation.
“We are in the process of transferring the matter to EOW.” - DCP Zone 5 Ganesh Gawade

The police are working to identify assets for the recovery of investors' funds, as community concerns grow over the potential recovery of investments.

item.title: PM Modi to launch Pravasi Bharatiya Express on Wednesday | All about the special train - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi to Launch Pravasi Bharatiya Express on Wednesday

Date: Jan 07, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will flag off the Pravasi Bharatiya Express, a special tourist train for the Indian diaspora, from New Delhi’s Safdarjung railway station. This launch coincides with the 18th Pravasi Bharatiya Divas convention in Bhubaneswar, Odisha.

  • The Pravasi Bharatiya Express is designed for the Indian diaspora aged 45 to 65 years.
  • The train will travel for three weeks to multiple destinations including Ayodhya, Patna, Gaya, Varanasi, and more.
  • The launch date, January 9, commemorates Mahatma Gandhi's return to India from South Africa in 1915.
  • Accommodating 156 passengers, the tour aims to connect the Indian diaspora with their roots.
  • Organized under the 'Pravasi Teerth Darshan Yojana', it collaborates with IRCTC.
The Indian diaspora has emerged as one of the largest sources of remittance in the world. The Indian diaspora stands at 35.4 million, including 19.5 million Persons of Indian Origins (PIOs) and 15.8 million NRIs.

In summary, this initiative is expected to strengthen ties between the Indian diaspora and their homeland while boosting tourism in Odisha.
